intro: Eriocephalus variifolius, commonly known as the variable leaf eriocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that vary in size and shape, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. Eriocephalus variifolius is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
